content.label: but upgrade needed

I probably have over 200 hours in Slay the Spire for the PC. It is one of my fav games so it was an instant purchase when it came to iOS. Unfortunately they did very little to customize this game for phones. They just sorta squished everything to phone size and called it a day. The result is tiny text, unnecessary extra taps, and graphics that look great on larger screens but are a jumbled mess zoomed out.
I really really wish they would go back and give this another shot but I worry they won’t. I won’t ask for a refund because I want to support the dev but do not purchase unless you have an iPad.
And devs plz give this another shot I know you can produce something fantastic.

So I bought this game and I had a lot of problems with it crashing. Finally when it stopped crashing I was able to play it and although it was great, I don’t think it was worth $10. Some of the preview pictures are also misleading and make the game look cooler than it is. Still a great game, but I would only pay up to $5 for it.

title.label: Love the game. Hate the app.

content.label:
I play this on PC all the time, and loved it enough to buy it again on my phone. That being said, this port is terrible. It’s the exact same UI but shrunk down to a phone screen, making it really awkward to interact with. This version also seems to be riddled with bugs too. In a single run, I’ve had it randomly skip my turn 3 times, use cards on its own several times, and use the wrong card multiple times as well.

TL;DR: stay away from this port until devs decide to put any effort into it

Phones without a home button suffer from constant misplays when trying to exit the app.
No cloud save.

I heard someone mention this as the inspiration for Dream Quest.  While that game is an incredible little microcosm, this is the freakin’ galaxy.  You could easily spend years just playing the additional options.  I’m 50, my hands are a mite pudgier (I’m average not rail skinny now) and I can see some of the interface issues.  My only requests are:

1. Let cards that are let go snap back so I can easily reselect any one.
2. Put the card type (Attack, Skill, etc. in the tooltips). I almost have to squint on an iPhone X to see the card type, and also take my finger off too in the middle of play to see if one card affects others in my hand.
3. Could there be confirmation if a seed is highlighted in green that it’ll be played again? It doesn’t look like a copied seed toggle.  I know it’s easy to write down and punch back in and it’s also easier when I use seeds based on nasty phrases about various people’s mothers, but you know.
4. Can you fully disable particle effects on the lowest settings? They’re still everywhere (coins, corner animations) and eat a ton of battery.  To the game’s credit, it’s never caused a typical overheat.

Otherwise A+++++++++++.  So many character classes are recycles of each other but I LOVE the Defect class.  Super original! Get this now if you are considering any kind of destructive behavior.  It will hook you like a monkey pressing a bar and instead fill your head with a dreamy haze of great animation surpassed by epic gameplay.

Update: dear Lord is the Watcher a difficult class at Ascension Level 1.  I have played probably 60 times trying to clear it and just did yesterday.  Amazingly, I had great fun 58 of those times.

title.label: Fantastic but it’s still just on mobile.

content.label: Love Slay the Spire to death. Been playing it for a while now. Love that I can play on the go, but I gotta say I am a little salty that I lost my last boss fight due to the phone misreading what I wanted to do and getting me killed. Oh well.

title.label: The best IOS game I’ve ever had

content.label: The quibbles some have dinged this for are truly negligible.  It’s infinitely replayable and addictive fun.  If you haven’t played this game, get it:).
Crashes prior to reaching the menu 9/10 times. Gameplay is sluggish. QoL seems to be ignored, both in browsing your hand and in targeting.

This game is pure luck with your card draws. Get ready for defense cards when you need attack cards. I have played this game thoroughly and progressing is 100% based on LUCK! Lame.. games don’t get more frustrating or luckier than this one. Save your $10!
Game won’t start. $10 down the hole. iPhone 7, no clue why not.

This game desperately needs control of support (much like all other ports of this game already have) 
In this case, as an alternative, especially due to the frustrating and unintuitive touch controls.

Ipad mini 4 doesn’t even load the game. 
10$ wasted

title.label: Love the game, wish it was easier to read text

content.label: See title

title.label: Amazing, Perfect Game: PLEASE fix controls

content.label: I love this game, but the touch controls need some attention. Please address and this review jumps to a perfect 5 stars!!!

title.label: Should be 4 stars, but too buggy.

content.label: This game is fantastic, I’ve sunk 100+ hours into the PC version and could not wait for it to be on mobile. After playing the mobile for a while it’s obvious that the game is just to buggy where it is at right now. I cannot tell you how many times I’ve selected the wrong card and then played it without having the slightest intention of doing so. The game seems to run a little too slow for my liking at the moment as well. Fix those two things and it’ll be a 4 star game for sure.

title.label: Does not work on iPad mini 4

content.label: Love this game, but for it not to work on a popular iPad device and this problem has been known since June is not ok.

I don’t write reviews but Honestly I love the game 10/10 play it all the time. But the app shuts off my audio on my IPad I want to listen to my own music while I play please fix this cause other games don’t do this.

Hard to read the card effects, the description is always off screen, you have to tap and drag the card, but I have to always read around my finger, it’s really annoying. Also there’s no cross save. To not have cross save for your game in an ecosystem of devices is lazy.

Took me a while to appreciate just how deep this game is. Even with only 4 classes, each run is unique thanks to game-changing artifacts and rare cards. It’s possible to set up ridiculous combos that kill a boss in 1 turn. I greatly appreciate the ability to unlock new cards over time. My biggest complaint is that there should be an undo button; with the tiny phone interface it’s possible to make mistakes. Still, this will be on my phone for a long, long time. I hope new cards, enemies, and classes will be released!

title.label: The only thing the iPhone is good for.

content.label: Great application for a garbage device.

I’ve bout this game 3 times, once on steam, once on PlayStation, and once here. But only here am I having issues with trying to play it. Don’t get me wrong, I love the game, but it is disappointing when you spend $10 and the game doesn’t even open. Please fix this as soon as possible, this game is a really good time killer.

This game is the best game I’ve played this year. If you are just starting out make sure to remove cards like strikes from your deck as getting rid of those is huge. Then be careful not to take cards every time they are offered, only when they help the kind of hand you want. Fave game since FtL.

Great app but with needed changes. Since day 1 needed changes are mentioned by users but, until today, no news. Last update was 3 months ago. It shows the support needed is not offered. Will update once a new update is release.
too addictive
Hard, but satisfying.  Really needs cloud save or you will lose progress when upgrading devices.

A waste of money, updates have stopped. Still no cloud save. Lack of communication, support, or care from the developer. I will never buy another app from this developer & distributor again. App seems abandoned already by dev.

Love the game. One of the best digital games I’ve played. On a phone (8+)some of the text is a strain after a while but my biggest complaint is the user interface. 

- The scroll is terrible. No one uses scroll bars on mobile and tablet for a reason. Users naturally want to flick up and down to see multiple cards. This causes you to pick cards. Since picking the wrong card can actually ruin an entire run (hour+ investment) it’s a pretty big deal. Hmm? How do we solve this? It’s not rocket science, put in a undo button for card selection screens. Down the road redo the awful scroll. 
- I can’t read the bottom of the card text when it’s in my hand and since they move around it’s my natural tendency to want to move them up to keep reading. This can cause you to play the card.
Eventually you know your deck pretty well but it’s a minor nitpick. 
-upgraded option not visible on key screens. Too many trips to wiki when you could put some type of info button on card selection screens. 

Did I mention the game is amazing? It might be the first game I get on mobile and Steam, as it’s deserving of a better experience.

title.label: Amazingly fun, a few minor tweaks and it will be perfect.

content.label:
This game is dangerously addictive in how much fun it is. My work productivity took a bit of a hit for a few days when I first got it. It has tremendous replayability as every time you play it will be different and you can play around a lot with how you play it. I have a few minor quibbles that would make it better. 
1. It is too easy to accidentally select the wrong card when choosing one to upgrade, I’ve been scrolling through and accidentally selected a different one than I wanted repeatedly. 
2. It is easy to accidentally play the wrong card as to read the full text you have to tap them to raise them up to full visibility. It’s very easy to accidentally play the card when doing so, although I suspect that it’s less of an issue playing it on a tablet rather than on the iPhone with the difference of screen sizes.
3. The last issue is more of an ask than a bug. I would love it if the game had the functionality to allow you to listen to music, podcasts, or audiobooks while playing. While the music and the sound effects are well done, I like to listen to other things while playing games on my phone and whenever I load StS it automatically stops whatever I’m listening to in favor of the game’s soundtracks.
Other than those issues, the game is super fun if you like deck builders and I recommend it without reservation, more than worth the cost.

I don’t think I have to spend a lot of time saying how great StS is right?  It’s the best deck builder available and one of the all time best games ever made.  The port is less than optimal and I just wanted to throw my hat in talking about it so hopefully the devs can improve it in an update.  It’s too direct of a port from PC, the UI is, text, relics, etc is too small on phones.  Taking inspiration from the way Hearthstone handles it would be good here. Tap and hold on cards in hand should blow up the card on screen so the text can be read.  Tapping on the card as it works now is too clunky, because then another tap in the playing field plays the card, and I imagine this resulting in accidental plays.  The characters could be zoomed in on also.  Implementing the way HS handles your hand on mobile, where you tap to widen or shrink your hand would solve the cards blocking the characters the whole time if you zoom the camera in on the characters.  When you’re choosing a card reward, you need to be able to tap on one of the cards to blow it up and you should be able to see the upgraded version before making your choice.  There’s also a lot of screen real estate when choosing between the three cards, so I think they can be zoomed in on as well.  When selecting a card to play from your hand, it currently lets you drag it across the other cards in your hand, which I don’t think is necessary, you only need to be able to drag cards to characters in the field of play.  When you’re looking at relics, the tooltip covers a portion of the text saying what the relic does.  In the main view, tap and hold on the relics at the top of the screen should blow up the text saying what it does in the middle of the screen so you can read it, it’s too small currently.  

TLDR:  It’s UI is too small and should be made bigger, the controls need to be tweaked but the core game is awesome and an instabuy.

Edit:  The devs are working with the porting team to improve the mobile ux, so the game isn’t gonna be abandoned now that the port is done, which is great news!  I imagine the update would drop when the Android version is released.
Text could be a bit bigger, but other than that it’s perfect
10 dollars brought me 5 seconds worth of loading screen

It’s been months since release and we don’t have iCloud sync support, performance improvements on the latest phone and tablet lines from Apple, and interface improvements on phone with its tiny touch targets. This should not be running as poorly on an iPhone 11 as it does. Fix these issues please. It reflects poorly on both Humble Games and Mega Crit for continuing to allow the game to remain in this state.

title.label: Really great game, could use some changes

content.label:
Would really like an easier way to read cards during a match on my iPhone. If I click a card it would be nice if it signed itself out for easy reading.

A wish list item, make the game playable in portrait mode.

I’ll change to a five star review if the cards were easier to read.
Pay once play forever. Tons of replay value and I play it all the time.

The game is fantastic and addictive, but the deck UI needs some love. Card selection and viewing is very wonky, and on more than a few occasions has caused me to use the wrong card. It should be a slide out drawer or something. I dunno, but it needs to be improved.

title.label: Needs Cloud Saves and Music in Background

content.label: Still no cloud saves.... Am not able to listen to Spotify while playing, which is also really irritating. Other than that, I love this game.

title.label: Slay the Spire on mobile baby!

content.label:
I’d already played this game to death on console so I was really excited to find out that it was on mobile as well. However, after reading some reviews and posts, I heard that the game had issues with crashing and bad UI, which was concerning enough to make me put off buying it for a while...
...But after getting around to it and playing for 10 hours or so I can safely say that this game runs and plays great! The interface isn’t perfect, so you might have to spend some time making sure you’re selecting the right card, but it’s totally workable. There’s also a setting that helps you to not accidentally click things if you think you might need it.
As for the game itself, it’s extremely fun with a bunch of different strategies and possibilities. $10 is totally worth it, must buy!
With unlucky hands and extremely difficult bosses, I uninstalled this after multiple 2 hour long attempts just to be ended by a random action
The game doesn’t load past the initial screen, so glad I payed money for this.

Still playing but from what I find the coms are too powerful.  I should be able to strategies a win but the game plays enemies that can't be defeated, discouraging.  Played more to see if increasing in experience would increase my odds.  It did not. Game is not balanced for the decks.  Frustrated, deleted the game won't be playing this again.

Unfortunately cannot give a good rating when I paid $10 for a game that crashes on launch. Fix this and happy to give it the 5 stars it deserves. I have the game on Xbox and love it so when I saw it on the App Store was psyched to have it on the go but it is not working currently despite the update that has it was fixed. According to App Store my iPad mini 4 is compatible with this game. Disappointing.
Often, I can’t get through the first loading screen. It’s a great game when I can play. 5 star review when I can play when I want

Slay the Spire is a masterpiece and is a perfect fit for the mobile platform. Astounding depth with its seemingly endless card synergies and its incredible replay-ability make it a must have for both short breaks at work and long flights. Definitely a worthwhile investment.
I’ve literally spent 500+ hours on this game. Great for a long plane ride. Or playing with the kids. Just flawless execution.

- the game itself (when it runs) is awesome. Endless “builds” or card combinations to choose from, enveloped with a cartoony sense of humor that makes it enjoyable. 

- as of recently I’ve had to uninstall/hard reset my iPhone many times and the game still crashes before the title menu. In my opinion, hold off on purchasing until they roll out a patch which fixes this bug. 

Great game but not without it’s flaws!
the game crashing in ios13.7，open the game and watch a picture,after that,the game crash....
Port is decent to good, but lack of cloud save is a bit ridiculous in 2020.

The game on pc is great, but on iPhone, card selection is way too finicky, making it very difficult to read cards without playing them. Needs some serious patching. There are many iOS card games that have great selection controls.
